author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment. You can edit blocking comments, adding `[noblock]` to them in order to unblock auto-merging.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

@alexriss, it is possible to add a package with hotfixes without it being registered (even without the fixes being merged) by specifying a repo url and branch name. The only reason to make a separate package and register it is if there are multiple other packages that depend Blink.jl and want different stability levels than each other.

I'd also note that 

> "Empty" packages that do not yet have functionality are not ready to be registered.

([source](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/blob/master/README.md))

And the src diff between this and Blink.jl is currently empty, so I do not think this is ready for registration quite yet.

Do @pfitzseb, @MikeInnes, @nhdaly, or other maintainers of Blink.jl endorse this project?

I also prefer your original name [BlinkPrerelease](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/98004) over this new name because it is more clear what the package is for. The [naming guidelines](https://pkgdocs.julialang.org/v1/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1) state

> Err on the side of clarity, even if clarity seems long-winded to you.
>
>    RandomMatrices is a less ambiguous name than RndMat or RMT, even though the latter are shorter.

Yipes, it's definitely not good that Blink.jl fails to precompile in certain cases on 1.10. From my point of view, the ideal situation would be for Blink.jl to quickly release bugfixes (and thank you for fixing that bug!), that way all users of Blink.jl would benefit from the fixes, not just your users.

I've opened a [PR](https://github.com/JuliaGizmos/Blink.jl/pull/319) to Blink.jl accordingly.

I've added you as a maintainer for the Blink.jl repo, @alexriss.

Also, https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/98095 should address this
Oh wow, thank you very much and happy new year!
This should be closed, I think.

body:
